qas.question: Why did Feynman decide to turn down an offer from the Institute of Advanced Study?
Where did Feynman receive much inspiration?
The  Institute of Advanced Study and which other university colluded together to get Feynman a position?
Ultimately Feynman decided to take a job at which college?
In which city did Feynman find himself affixing tire chains?
Why did Feynman decide to accept all offers from the Institute of Advanced Study?
Where did Feynman receive no inspiration?
What university forbid Feynman from being on campus?
What college did Feynman end up living in?
Which city did Feynman get lost in after affixing tire chains?

context: Despite yet another offer from the Institute for Advanced Study, Feynman rejected the Institute on the grounds that there were <a0_0><b5_0>no teaching duties<b5_0/><a0_0/>: Feynman felt that <a1_0><b6_0>students<b6_0/><a1_0/> were a source of inspiration and teaching was a diversion during uncreative spells. Because of this, the Institute for Advanced Study and <a2_0><b7_0>Princeton University<b7_0/><a2_0/> jointly offered him a package whereby he could teach at the university and also be at the institute.[citation needed] Feynman instead accepted an offer from the <a3_0><b8_0>California Institute of Technology<a3_0/> (Caltech)<b8_0/>—and as he says in his book Surely You're Joking Mr. Feynman!—because a desire to live in a mild climate had firmly fixed itself in his mind while he was installing tire chains on his car in the middle of a snowstorm in <a4_0><b9_0>Ithaca<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
